From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To display the capacities and utilizations for the hardware resources, use the **show platform hardware capacity** command in privileged EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: (Optional) Hardware resource type; see the "Usage Guidelines" section for the valid values.

Examples: Router# show platform hardware capacity cpu
CPU utilization: Module 5 seconds 1 minute 5 minutes
Processor memory: Module Bytes: Total Used %Used
I/O memory: Module Bytes: Total Used %Used
Router# show platform hardware capacity eobc
Module Packets/sec Total packets Dropped packets
Router# show platform hardware capacity fabric
Bus utilization: current is 100%, peak was 100% at 12:34 12mar45
Module channel speed current peak current peak
Router# show platform hardware capacity flash
Usage: Module Device Bytes: Total Used %Used
Router# show platform hardware capacity forwarding
MAC Table usage: Module Collisions Total Used %Used
Key: ACLent - ACL TCAM entries, ACLmsk - ACL TCAM masks, AND - ANDOR,
QoSent - QoS TCAM entries, QOSmsk - QoS TCAM masks, OR - ORAND,
Lbl-in - ingress label, Lbl-eg - egress label, LOUsrc - LOU source,
LOUdst - LOU destination, ADJ - ACL adjacency
Module ACLent ACLmsk QoSent QoSmsk Lbl-in Lbl-eg LOUsrc LOUdst AND OR ADJ
Router# show platform hardware capacity interface
Module Total drops: Tx Rx Highest drop port: Tx Rx
Module Bytes: Tx buffer Rx buffer
Router# show platform hardware capacity monitor
Router# show platform hardware capacity multicast
Bi-directional PIM Designated Forwarder Table usage: 4 total, 0 (0%) used
MET table Entries: Module Total Used %Used
Router# show platform hardware capacity power
Power supply redundancy mode: administratively combined
Router# show platform hardware capacity qos
Microflow policer configurations: Module Total Used %Used
Router# show platform hardware capacity system
Supervisor redundancy mode: administratively rpr-plus, operationally rpr-plus
Switching Resources: Module Part number Series CEF mode
Router# show platform hardware capacity vlan
VLANs: 4094 total, 10 VTP, 0 extended, 0 internal, 4084 free
ExtraInfo: The valid values for *resource-type* are as follows:•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**acl**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for ACL/QoS TCAM resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**cpu**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for CPU resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**eobc**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for Ethernet out-of-band channel resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**fabric**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for Switch Fabric resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**flash**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for Flash/NVRAM resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**forwarding**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for Layer 2 and Layer 3 forwarding resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**ibc**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for interboard communication resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**interface**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for interface resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**monitor**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for SPAN resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**multicast**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for Layer 3 multicast resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**netflow**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for NetFlow resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**pfc**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for all the PFC resources including Layer 2 and Layer 3 forwarding, NetFlow, CPU rate limiters, and ACL/QoS TCAM resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**power**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for power resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**qos**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for QoS policer resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**rate-limiter**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for CPU rate limiter resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**rewrite-engine**—Displays the packet drop and performance counters of the central rewrite engine on supervisors and line cards. For detailed information, see the **show platform hardware capacity rewrite-engine**command documentation.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**system**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for system resources.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**vlan**—Displays the capacities and utilizations for VLAN resources.The **show platform hardware capacity cpu** command displays the following information:•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)CPU utilization for the last 5 seconds (busy time and interrupt time), the percentage of the last 1-minute average busy time, and the percentage of the last 5-minute average busy time.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Processor memory total available bytes, used bytes, and percentage used.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)I/O memory total available bytes, used bytes, and percentage used.The **show platform hardware capacity eobc** command displays the following information:•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Transmit and receive rate•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Packets received and packets sent•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Dropped received packets and dropped transmitted packetsThe **show platform hardware capacity** **forwarding** command displays the following information:•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)The total available entries, used entries, and used percentage for the MAC tables.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)The total available entries, used entries, and used percentage for the FIB TCAM tables. The display is done per protocol base.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)The total available entries, used entries, and used percentage for the adjacency tables. The display is done for each region in which the adjacency table is divided.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)The created entries, failures, and resource usage percentage for the NetFlow TCAM and ICAM tables.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)The total available entries and mask, used entries and mask, reserved entries and mask, and entries and mask used percentage for the ACL/QoS TCAM tables. The output displays the available, used, reserved, and used percentage of the labels. The output displays the resource of other hardware resources that are related to the ACL/QoS TCAMs (such as available, used, reserved, and used percentage of the LOU, ANDOR, and ORAND).•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)The available, used, reserved, and used percentage for the CPU rate limiters.The **show platform hardware capacity interface** command displays the following information:•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Tx/Rx drops—Displays the sum of transmit and receive drop counters on each online module (aggregate for all ports) and provides the port number that has the highest drop count on the module.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Tx/Rx per port buffer size—Summarizes the port-buffer size on a per-module basis for modules where there is a consistent buffer size across the module.The **show platform hardware capacity monitor** command displays the following SPAN information:•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)The maximum local SPAN sessions, maximum RSPAN sessions, maximum ERSPAN sessions, and maximum service module sessions.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)The local SPAN sessions used/available, RSPAN sessions used/available, ERSPAN sessions used/available, and service module sessions used/available.The **show platform hardware capacity** **multicast** command displays the following information:•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Multicast Replication Mode: ingress and egress IPv4 and IPv6 modes.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)The MET table usage that indicates the total used and the percentage used for each module in the system.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)The bidirectional PIM DF table usage that indicates the total used and the percentage used.The **show platform hardware capacity system** command displays the following information:•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)PFC operating mode (PFC Version: PFC3A, PFC3B, unknown, and so forth)•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Supervisor redundancy mode (RPR, RPR+, SSO, none, and so forth)•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Module-specific switching information, including the following information:–![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Part number (WS-SUP720-BASE, WS-X6548-RJ-45, and so forth)–![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Series (supervisor engine, fabric, CEF720, CEF256, dCEF256, or classic)–![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)CEF Mode (central CEF, dCEF)The **show platform hardware capacity** **vlan** command displays the following VLAN information:•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Total VLANs•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)VTP VLANs that are used•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)External VLANs that are used•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Internal VLANs that are used•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Free VLANs
